video.title: Why software engineers disagree about everything - talk by Haseeb Qureshi
video.description:
Why are there are so many disagreements in software? Why don’t we all converge on the same beliefs or technologies? It might sound obvious that people shouldn't agree, but Haseeb want to convince you it’s weird that we don't. This talk is a philosophical exploration of how knowledge converges within subcultures, as Haseeb explore this question through the worlds of software, online fraud, and poker.

Talk by Haseeb Qureshi at RailsConf 2017.

This talk is under the creative commons license. freeCodeCamp is not associated with this talk. We're just excited to bring more exposure to to it!

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: deepak karki
topLevelComment.text: Can we have the link to the original video?

topLevelComment.author: Bartu Baş
topLevelComment.text: I loved the terrain and poker examples, good point on real risks. Hell of a speech!

topLevelComment.author: Michael Flores
topLevelComment.text: "If you're a senior software engineer" - you guys don't hire anyone else?

topLevelComment.author: Doctor Jorge
topLevelComment.text: He's a really really good speaker!

topLevelComment.author: MC
topLevelComment.text: Logos means Word, not Etymology as you state in the first minute.

topLevelComment.author: Reza Thr
topLevelComment.text:
Interesting ideas. Bravo! 
Just an opinion, I think the term "Dynamic" (as in constantly changing) suits reason #1 better instead of saying the terrain is "unstable".
